page.title: 02The Shuttleworth Family
page.content: The most well known of the Shuttleworths was Richard who became squire of Old Warden in 1913.He built the aerodrome at Old Warden and made a collection of old cars and aeroplanes, which he restored to working order.These cars and planes provided the nucleus from which the Shuttleworth Collection of today has been built up.On his death in 1940 the estate and possessions were left to his wife and as a fitting memorial to Richard and his father the House was turned into the present Agricultural College. Much of the village still remains the property of the estate and has been given the county's protection so that development in this area is very restricted.
